Quirk: They dream of being an adventurer, but their parents, spouse, drinking buddies, etc. keep talking them out of it. They are constantly sneaking peeks at your armor and weaponry, trying to hide their jealousy.
They are very religious. One of their daily prayers is coming up, and they really want this conversation to end so they can make their way to the temple.
They occasionally sneak sips from a leather-wrapped hip flask. If they like the player, they'll offer them a nip. It's the vilest bathtub moonshine imaginable.
They smack their lips way, way, way too often.
They start laughing out of nowhere. When questioned, they say that they just remembered a joke about a freshly plucked harpy that isn't suitable for polite company.
They are a sailor on shore leave. They're trying to pack in as much drinking, gambling, and general chicanery as possible before their crew sets sail.
They love to garden. Their fingernails are always caked in dirt, and they occasionally have bits of twigs stuck in their hair.
They have a beloved dog that follows them everywhere. The dog likes snuffling for treats in strangers' pockets.
They write pulpy stories on the side. They're always jotting down notes on a little slate tablet, and will do nearly anything to witness something grim, gritty, or grisly.
They just moved into town from a distant land, and everyone thinks they don't know the local language. In reality, they just don't like chatting.
They were born in a distant town. Their wagon broke down while passing through town, and they decided to just live there instead of fixing it. The wagon is still there, with a single broken axle.
They have lived alone for years, meditating on the purpose of the multiverse. They came back once they found it.
They are absolutely obsessed with foraging. They can identify every local plant, know exactly where to find it, and can cook it to perfection.
They have a strange accent and refuses to tell the party where they picked it up.
They have read every book in town, but never traveled beyond its borders. They think they're ready for anything.
They are known across the region for their honesty. Gamblers regularly come into town just so the NPC can deal with their high-stakes games.
They have a shed on the edge of their property, where they tinker late into the night.
They have an uncanny ability to predict the weather. They often guide the conversation towards temperatures and cloud movements.
Their jerky recipe is the pride of the town. They're always willing to buy or trade for fresh meat from the party's adventures.
They looks severe and talks in a sneering voice, but is actually kind-hearted and generous.
They have nine children, with another on the way. They'd do nearly anything for a night of peace and quiet.
They have good taste. They quickly pick out the little flourishes in the party's equipment and sincerely compliment subtle details.
They have OCD and is constantly trying to organize things.
They have no sense of direction and will always go the wrong way.
They are fixated on having the newest cutting edge gadgets, many of which don't work as advertised.
They never seem to be paying attention but can recite back anything said to him/her/them word-for-word.
They have a lifelong bird watching list and will drop everything to see a bird not on the list.
Whenever someone changes the topic from what they were talking about, they say, 'Uh huh. Anyway...' before returning to what they were saying.
They pepper their speech with words from other languages.
They habitually whistle a tune, a sort of personal theme song.
They have been learning a new instrument / writing on their next song, and insists on having others listen to what they've been working on.
They prefer if they're the only one holding any sharp tool / weapon in the room, and will insist on handling anything that requires a knife themselves.
They have a bit of satyr blood in them, so when speaking they have a goat-like stu-u-u-tter.
They are overly secretive of their books / folders, even if they're of no high importance, like their diary.
They never swear.
They swear every other sentence.
They assume the worst out of any situation presented to them, even something as nice as a picnic could have disastrous effects in their eyes.
They go starkly silent around anyone they find remotely attractive.
They talk relentlessly to fill the awkward silence, even if they would like to shut up, around anyone they find remotely attractive.
They constantly reminisce about the golden ages or the 'good old days', even if the period they're alluding to wasn't that great.
They are scared of gore and faints at the sight of blood.
They need to wear a certain piece of jewelry or clothing in order to feel comfortable or safe.
They comment on things they observe in others out loud. Even observations most would keep to themselves.
They love gossiping and any piece of juicy info, or just has a constant curiosity in the goings on of others.
They have a tendency to spill secrets, theirs and others', though they don't mean to.
They melt and coo at the sight of any remotely 'cute' animal, from cats to dogs to fluffy and lethal owlbears.
They have selective mutism. As a result, they have a few different ways of communicating non-verbally whenever they need to.
They love to hear themself talk, and always finds a way to insert their personal stories into a conversation.
They love listening to people talking about their interest, and even if they're not particularly interested in the object of discussion, will ask follow-up questions.
They have an unhealthy obsession for tea, drinking an unacceptable amount every day.
They are literate, and considers grammar vital for one's success. They will correct and be annoyed by PCs if they're not speaking prope
They often lose their train of thought and tends to quickly jump from one topic to the next.
They tell inappropriate jokes at the WORST times.
They have an interesting story for every occasion. Sometimes, these stories tend to drag on for way too long.
They cannot stand the ocean, or any body of water. They are DEATHLY afraid of the open sea.
They are very religious and typically likes to adorn their clothing with symbols of their God/Goddess.
They want everyone to think they are an intellectual. They sometimes use big words to sound smart, but they don't always know what they mean.
They are very jumpy, and can easily be frightened by loud noises or someone walking up behind them.
They sound sweet but are very passive-aggressive and judgmental, bless their heart.
They keeps food in their pockets to feed wildlife.
They have a hobby that they are very happy to tell you about if you show even the slightest hint of interest.
They are on a diet and are very envious of anyone around them eating delicious food or drink.
They are never idle; they can't just sit and do nothing. They're usually busy doing something: reading a book, whittling, gathering flowers, etc.
They are paranoid, by pretty much anything and anyone. There is always a conspiracy brewing somewhere that involves them.
They are patient —too patient for their own good.
They are a neat freak, they love to clean. When someone meets them, they're usually seen with a broom or a cloth, cleaning something or another.
They love to ponder the big questions: who are we and why are we here?
They love to cook and will always offer food to her guests, even if they decline her offer.
They are fascinated by phrenology, and desperately wants to measure the heads of every creature she meets.
They are gruff and taciturn except when talking to kids because they remind him of his own kids.
They can't handle their alcohol. The NPC also loves to indulge.
They can't stand being wrong and will try to destroy every reasoning that could show them this. If proven wrong, the NPC will sulk for days on end.
They are always doing something with their hands out of nervousness: braiding hair, thrumming fingers on the table, picking at the hem of their shirt.
They are an unabashed flirt but will freeze up if approached first.
They do not believe in magic and will not believe in magic even if someone invokes Tiamat in front of them.
They seem tired and talk and walk slowly and kind of in a slumber.
They try to give the PC advice in the form of sayings from his home country. Sometimes they fit, sometimes they don´t.
They tend to daydream. Sometimes he seems far off and is not listening. Even when he seems to listen closely, he asks to repeat the last part.
They dislike violence, but understands that some problems can´t be solved any other way. He may ask for the PCs to come up with a non-violent solution.
They distrust everyone and everything and is pleasantly surprised when something happens just as promised or discussed.
They are on a quest to find rare and elusive potion making ingredients. They regularly turn up with new injuries.
They don't believe in elves.
They have been mandated by a nature goddess to find and categorize every type of mushroom. They categorize them very badly, and should not be trusted to make meals.
They are a ten thousand year old dragon in disguise, just havin' a right giggle at causing all sorts of trouble.
They are always trying to trip on magic mushrooms and they try to hide the fact.
They have an intense distrust for the city guard.
They are fidgety and frequently looks at the sky or ceiling to check for monsters.
They see any new piece of information as a potential deception.
They are quick to get into fights in order to test their own strength.
They are not content unless they are the most extravagantly dressed person in the room.
They are incredibly helpful, whether you want them to be or not.
They often speak in riddles or rhymes and making sense of it all can be quite challenging.
They follow rules to the letter even when it inconveniences them and everyone around them.
They speak to everyone in a calm but condescending voice almost as if they were speaking to a child.
They treat their tools/vehicle with more love and affection than their own family.
They give everyone a nickname and refuse to learn their real names.
They are always carrying food on a stick, and if asked, will highly recommend the dubious stall they got it from.
They insist on carrying things too heavy for them, or taking care of delicate objects they invariably break, or watching over valuables they will definitely lose.
They sleep all day and stay up all night.
